kpis.name: Total Revenue
kpis.description: Sum of sales across all transactions
kpis.reason: Revenue is a critical measure of sales performance, reflecting the overall business growth and success. It is essential for understanding the financial health of the e-commerce operations.

kpis.name: Average Order Value
kpis.reason: This KPI helps in understanding customer spending behavior and is crucial for assessing the effectiveness of pricing strategies and sales promotions.

kpis.name: Customer Count
kpis.reason: Tracking the number of unique customers provides insights into the customer base size and helps in evaluating customer acquisition and retention strategies.

charts.name: Revenue Over Time
charts.description: Shows total revenue trends over time
charts.reason: Visualizing revenue over time helps identify trends, seasonality, and anomalies, which are crucial for strategic planning and forecasting.

charts.name: Sales by Country
charts.description: Compares total sales across different countries
charts.reason: Understanding sales distribution by country is vital for market analysis and helps in tailoring marketing strategies to different regions.

charts.name: Top Selling Products
charts.description: Identifies products with the highest sales volume
charts.reason: Highlighting top-selling products aids in inventory management and helps focus marketing efforts on popular items.

charts.name: Order Quantity Distribution
charts.description: Shows the distribution of order quantities
charts.reason: Analyzing order quantity distribution helps in understanding purchasing patterns and can inform inventory and supply chain decisions.

charts.name: Customer Distribution by Country
charts.description: Displays the proportion of customers from each country
charts.reason: This chart provides insights into the geographical distribution of the customer base, which is useful for targeted marketing and expansion strategies.
